title: Aid for quake victims sought
author: Unknown
text: BELLEVUE - Relief donations for victims of the Kobe earthquake are being collected by the Bellevue Sister Cities Association.     Yao, Bellevue's Japanese sister city 15 miles southeast of Kobe, sustained minor damage.     Eastside residents can help victims in Kobe by donating cash or by donating or buying rummage-sale items.     Donations for the rummage sale should be delivered between 2:30 and 3:30 p.m. today to the Bellevue City Hall lobby, 11511 Main St. The rummage sale will be held from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturday at the Bellevue Conference Center, 505 106th Ave. N.E.     The sale, organized by more than 15 Eastside Japanese families and many others, will include traditional Japanese items. Proceeds will go to the American Red Cross, earmarked for Kobe assistance.     Cash donations may be sent to the Bellevue Sister Cities Association, c/o Dorothy Webb, 11011 N.E. 12th St., No. 207, Bellevue, WA 98004
